lines.text: I could've had an abortion.
You should've. Could've saved us a lot of trouble, bitch!
You didn't deserve to die then.

[the gun clicks empty, Jeremy gasps]
I don't believe it! I finally get a break!
[last lines]
I bet you wish you could send me to my room now huh?
You have no idea what I've been through because of you.
They were supposed to make you feel special, you were supposed to feel chosen.

[screams]
YOU CARRIED ME IN YOUR BODY FOR NINE MONTHS! DO YOU REALLY THINK SOMEONE ELSE COULD EVER TREAT ME SPECIAL? HUH? DO YOU? SOME FUCKING STRANGER?
The abortion pill? that was pretty easy. But it's taken me three years to do this the hard way, to take away everything you sacrificed me for.
I didn't sacrifice you for anything.
Twenty minutes, Sandy, you did not forget what midnight is did you?
No.
Well this year instead of my birthday it's going to be
[screams]
MY MOTHER'S DAY!

[after rescuing Sandy and knocking Jeremy unconscious with a wooden board]
You're fired, you son of a bitch!

[on the tape that Jeremy is showing to Sandy]
Well fuck Sandy! Sounds to me like she deserves whatever she gets!
Jeremy?
[clearly scared at this point]
I don't know what you're trying to pull, but there are people that know I'm here!
I doubt it. What you do is illegal!
[Christina runs]
Dad's situation could've easily passed as a little revenge on his slut wife and suicide, but you had to be a nosy parker, didn't you?
You set me up on Waterman, didn't you? Oh, come on! You already got my job.
There's only one other guy on the elevator, and you smell a fart. Does anybody really have to admit to anything?
